longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of a Hong Kong Deposit Protection Board; to provide for the establishment by the Board of a Deposit Protection Scheme for the purpose of providing compensation to depositors under certain circumstances in respect of deposits maintained with banks that are members of the Scheme; to provide for the establishment of a Deposit Protection Scheme Fund from which such compensation is to be paid; to provide for contributions to the Fund and for the entitlement to, and payment of, compensation from the Fund; to make consequential and other amendments to other Ordinances; and to provide for connected purposes.

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Deposit Protection Scheme Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: Applicant
def.leadIn: applicant (申請人) means a person who applies to the Tribunal under section 41(1), (2) or (3) for a review of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a decision, or an assessment, of the Board; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a decision of the Monetary Authority;

subsection.def: authorized institution (認可機構) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155);

def.name: Bank
def.leadIn: bank (銀行) means a company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that holds a valid banking licence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the banking licence of which is for the time being suspended under section 24 or 25 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155);

subsection.def: banking licence (銀行牌照) means a banking licence granted under section 16 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155);

bare trustee (被動受託人), in relation to a deposit or portion thereof, means a person holding the deposit or that portion on trust for a beneficiary where the beneficiary has the exclusive right to direct how the deposit or that portion is to be dealt with subject only to the right of the person to resort to the deposit or that portion to satisfy any outstanding charge or lien or for the payment of duty, taxes, costs or other outgoings;

chief executive (行政總裁), in relation to a Scheme member or a bank, means the chief executive appointed under section 74 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) in respect of the Scheme member or the bank, and includes an alternate chief executive so appointed;

client account (客戶帳戶), in relation to a depositor, means an account maintained by the depositor with a bank for the purpose of holding money held by the depositor for a client of the depositor, whether or not other money may be held in the account;

def.name: Contribution
def.leadIn: contribution (供款) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the build-up levy within the meaning of Schedule 4;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the expected loss levy within the meaning of Schedule 4; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the surcharge within the meaning of Schedule 4;

subsection.def: deposit (存款) has the meaning assigned to it in the definition of deposit in section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) except that, despite paragraph (b)(ii) of that definition, it includes a loan of money referred to in paragraph (a) of that definition that is subject to any security (including any form of encumbrance, charge, mortgage, pledge, lien and right of set off) referable to the provision of any banking or financial services; (Amended 11 of 2010 s. 3)
Exchange Fund (外匯基金) means the Exchange Fund established by the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66);
Exchange Fund Bill (外匯基金票據) means any instrument described as such which is issued by the Government for the account of the Exchange Fund under the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66);
failed Scheme member (無力償付成員) means a Scheme member in relation to which a specified event has, for the purposes of Part 5, occurred;
function (職能) includes a power and a duty;
HKAB (香港銀行公會) means The Hong Kong Association of Banks incorporated by section 3 of The Hong Kong Association of Banks Ordinance (Cap. 364);
holding company (控權公司) has the meaning given by section 13 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) for the purposes of that Ordinance; (Replaced 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)
information system (資訊系統) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553);
late payment fee (逾期繳付費) means the late payment fee imposed by the Board under section 15(4)(a);
liquidator (清盤人) means a liquidator appointed by virtue of or under section 194 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

def.name: MASupervisoryRating
def.leadIn: MA supervisory rating (專員監管評級), in relation to a Scheme member, means the supervisory rating that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is from time to time assigned to the Scheme member by the Monetary Authority; and

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: Monetary Authority (金融管理專員) means the Monetary Authority appointed under section 5A of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66);
protected deposit (受保障存款) means a deposit denominated in any currency and maintained with a Scheme member but does not include those specified in section 1 of Schedule 1;

provisional liquidator (臨時清盤人) means a provisional liquidator appointed under section 193, or appointed by virtue of section 194, of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)
re-domiciled entity (經遷冊實體) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155); (Added 14 of 2025 s. 263)

def.name: RelatedPerson
def.leadIn: related person (有關連人士), in relation to the Board, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person employed or authorized by the Board under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.text: a person appointed as an agent or adviser of the Board under this Ordinance;

subsection.def: relevant deposit (有關存款) means a deposit denominated in any currency and maintained with a Scheme member but does not include those specified in section 2 of Schedule 1;
resolution authority (處置機制當局) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628); (Added 23 of 2016 s. 223 and E.R. 2 of 2017)
Scheme member (計劃成員) means a bank that is a member of the Scheme;
subsidiary (附屬公司) has the meaning given by section 15 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) for the purposes of that Ordinance; (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)
trustee (受託人) does not include a bare trustee;
US Treasury Bill (美國國庫券) means a security, with an original maturity of not more than 12 months, issued by the Department of Treasury of the United States of America.

subsection.content: In this Ordinance, a reference to the performance of a function includes the exercise of a power and the discharge of a duty.

If a deposit, or portion thereof, held by a depositor in a client account for a client is also held by the depositor as a trustee or bare trustee under a trust or bare trust, the deposit or portion is, for the purposes of this Ordinance, taken as being held by the depositor for the client and not as such trustee or bare trustee.

For the avoidance of doubt, any reference in this Ordinance to the commission of an offence by every director and every chief executive of a Scheme member or a bank (including any grammatical variations or cognate expressions of such reference) means that one or more than one of any such director and chief executive may be prosecuted for the offence.
A note located in the text of this Ordinance is provided for information only and has no legislative effect. (Added 19 of 2024 s. 3)

section.name: s3
section.heading: Establishment of Hong Kong Deposit Protection Board

subsection.content: There is established by this section a body corporate with the corporate name of “Hong Kong Deposit Protection Board” in English and “香港存款保障委員會” in Chinese.

subsection.leadIn: The Board—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has perpetual succession under its corporate name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall provide itself with a common seal; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is capable of suing and being sued in its corporate name.

subsection.content: The Board is not a servant or agent of the Government nor does it enjoy any status, immunity or privilege of the Government.

subsection.leadIn: The Board is to consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury, or a person appointed by the Secretary, in writing, as his representative, as an ex officio member;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority, or a person appointed by the Authority, in writing, as his representative, as an ex officio member; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: not fewer than 4 and not more than 7 other members appointed by the Chief Executive from among persons who, either because of their experience in finance, accounting, banking, law, administration, information technology or consumer affairs, or because of their professional or occupational experience, appear to the Chief Executive to be suitable for the appointment.

subsection.leadIn: The following are not eligible for appointment under subsection(1)(c)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person who is a director, or an employee, of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an authorized institution;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a holding company of an authorized institution;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a subsidiary of such a holding company; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a subsidiary of an authorized institution.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive shall appoint one appointed member of the Board as Chairman of the Board.
The Chief Executive shall give notice of each appointment under subsection (1)(c) or (3) by notice published in the Gazette.
Schedule 2 has effect with respect to the Board.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Functions of Board
section.leadIn: The Board has the following functions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to establish and maintain the Scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to manage and administer the Fund;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to assess and collect contributions and late payment fees;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to decide the entitlement of depositors and other persons to compensation under Division 2 of Part 5;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to pay compensation to depositors in accordance with this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to pay rebates or refunds of contributions to Scheme members in accordance with this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: to recover from, or out of the assets of, the Scheme member concerned any amount of compensation paid to depositors from the Fund, together with any interest accrued thereon in accordance with section 38; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: such other functions as are imposed on it under this Ordinance.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Board to perform functions through Monetary Authority

subsection.content: Unless otherwise directed by the Financial Secretary, the Board shall perform its functions under this Ordinance through the Monetary Authority.
For the purposes of subsection (1), the Monetary Authority shall, under the direction of the Board, do all acts and things necessary for implementing the decisions of the Board.
All costs and expenses incurred by the Monetary Authority for the purposes of subsection (1) shall be charged on the Exchange Fund.

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may, in relation to the costs and expenses that were charged under subsection (3) during such period as may be determined by him, direct that those costs and expenses, or such portion thereof as may be determined by him—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be recoverable from the Fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall, at a time determined by him, be paid to the Exchange Fund by the Board from the Fund.

subsection.content: The Board shall comply with any direction given under subsection (4).

section.name: s7
section.heading: Powers of Board
section.leadIn: The Board has power to do all such things as are necessary for, or incidental or conducive to, the performance of its functions and in particular, but without prejudice to the foregoing, may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: borrow money from the Government or any other person for the purpose of performing its functions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: claim from the liquidator or provisional liquidator of a failed Scheme member payment out of the assets of the failed Scheme member for reimbursement of the amount of compensation paid to the depositors concerned from the Fund, together with any interest accrued thereon in accordance with section 38;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide an indemnity to the liquidator or provisional liquidator of a failed Scheme member for the purpose of obtaining an early payment out of the assets of the failed Scheme member;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: make any compromise, agreement or arrangement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: with the liquidator or provisional liquidator of a failed Scheme member, or with any other person, in respect of its claim against the assets of the failed Scheme member; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: with any person in respect of its claim against a Scheme member, in relation to which it is deemed under section 24 that a specified event never occurred;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: with the consent of the Financial Secretary, petition the Court of First Instance for the winding up of a Scheme member;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: employ persons to assist the Board in the performance of its functions;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: appoint persons as agents, or authorize persons—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to assist the Board in the performance of its functions; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the Board is to perform its functions through the Monetary Authority, to assist the Monetary Authority in the performance of such functions;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: appoint persons as advisers to assist the Board in the performance of its functions;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: hold, acquire, lease, sell, charge, dispose of or otherwise deal with all kinds of property whether movable or immovable;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: do all such things as the Board thinks fit in respect of its administration and management; and

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: exercise such other powers as are conferred on the Board under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Board may issue, for the guidance of banks or depositors, guidelines not inconsistent with this Ordinance, indicating the manner in which it proposes to perform its functions under this Ordinance.
The Board shall publish a guideline issued under this section in the Gazette.
The Board may amend or revoke a guideline issued under this section. Subsection (2) applies to the amendment or revocation of a guideline in the same way as it applies to the issue of a guideline.

subsection.leadIn: A person does not incur a civil or criminal liability only because the person has contravened a guideline issued under this section. If in any legal proceedings the court is satisfied that such a guideline is relevant to determining a matter that is in issue in the proceedings—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the guideline is admissible in evidence in the proceedings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proof that the person contravened or did not contravene the guideline may be relied on by any party to the proceedings as tending to establish or negate the matter.

subsection.content: A guideline issued under this section is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.def: In this section, court (法院) includes a magistrate and the Tribunal.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Directions of Chief Executive in Council

subsection.content: After consultation with the Chairman of the Board, the Chief Executive in Council may, on being satisfied that it is in the public interest to do so, give the Board such written directions as he thinks fit with respect to the performance of any of the Board’s functions under this Ordinance.
The Board shall comply with any written direction given under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: If a written direction is given under subsection (1), a requirement under an Ordinance that the Board shall, for the purpose of performing any of the functions to which the written direction relates—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: form any opinion;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be satisfied as to any matter (including existence of particular circumstances); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: consult any person,

subsection.continued: does not apply for any purpose connected with the performance of functions pursuant to, or consequent upon, the written direction.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Exemption from taxation
section.content: The Board is exempt from taxation under the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112).

section.name: s11
section.heading: Establishment of Deposit Protection Scheme
section.content: The Board shall, for the purposes of this Ordinance, establish and maintain a scheme to be known as the “Deposit Protection Scheme” in English and “存款保障計劃” in Chinese.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 13, every bank is a member of the Scheme and remains as such until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company ceases to be a bank by virtue of section 18(3) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: its banking licence is revoked under that Ordinance.

subsection.content: In the case of a bank the banking licence of which was granted on or before the commencement* of this section, it becomes a member of the Scheme on that commencement.
In the case of a bank the banking licence of which is granted after the commencement of this section, it becomes a member of the Scheme on the date on which its banking licence is granted.
A bank may apply to the Board for an exemption from section 12(1).

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (1) for an exemption is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be made in the manner specified by the Board; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be accompanied by such information and documents as the Board may reasonably require for the purpose of deciding whether the exemption should be granted.

subsection.leadIn: The Board may, on receipt of an application under subsection (1) from a bank—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: exempt the bank from section 12(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse to so exempt the bank.

subsection.leadIn: The Board shall not exempt a bank from section 12(1) unless it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the bank is incorporated outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: the bank is not a re-domiciled entity; (Added 14 of 2025 s. 264)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the deposits taken by the bank at its Hong Kong offices are protected by a deposit protection scheme, or other scheme of a similar nature, established and maintained in the jurisdiction in which the bank is incorporated or domiciled; and (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 264)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the scope and level of protection available to those deposits under that scheme are not in all material respects narrower, and lower, than those that would be available to those deposits under the Scheme if the bank were not exempted.

subsection.leadIn: If the Board exempts a bank from section 12(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it is a condition of the exemption—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that the bank shall pay an annual exemption fee of such amount as may be specified by the Board from time to time;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that the bank shall forthwith notify the Board of any change of circumstances which may affect the exemption and, if so required by the Board, supply further information and documents to assist the Board in deciding whether the exemption should continue to be granted; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: where the bank is exempted from section 12(1) after having been a member of the Scheme, that the bank shall, in relation to any deposit taken by it before the date specified in the notice referred to in subsection (6) as the date on which the exemption takes effect—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: at the written request of the depositor made within 3 months after that date; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: without imposing any fee or penalty on the depositor,

subparagraph.continued: repay the deposit, and pay the interest accrued thereon, prior to maturity; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Board may impose such other conditions of the exemption as the Board considers appropriate.

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after having made a decision on an application under subsection (1) from a bank, the Board shall give notice in writing to the bank of its decision and, in the case of a decision to refuse to exempt the bank from section 12(1) or to impose any condition under subsection (5)(b), the reasons for its decision.
An exemption from section 12(1) remains in force until it is revoked by the Board.

subsection.leadIn: The Board may, by notice in writing given to a bank the subject of an exemption from section 12(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: impose any further condition of the exemption as the Board considers appropriate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: vary any condition imposed under paragraph (a) or subsection (5)(b);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: revoke any condition imposed under paragraph (a) or subsection (5)(b); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: revoke the exemption if any condition of the exemption has not been or is not being complied with,

subsection.continued: and shall, in the case of a decision to impose any further condition, vary any condition or to revoke an exemption, state the reasons for its decision in the notice.

subsection.content: Before exercising its power under subsection (3)(b), (5)(b) or (8)(a), (b) or (d), the Board shall afford the bank an opportunity, within such period as the Board may specify in writing, being a period reasonable in all the circumstances, of being heard.

subsection.leadIn: A bank exempted from section 12(1) shall, as soon as practicable after the relevant time, inform in writing its depositors, or any person who is not already a depositor of the bank but has informed the bank that he intends to make a deposit with the bank—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that it is not a member of the Scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that any deposit, in whole or in part, taken by the bank at any of its Hong Kong offices is not protected by the Scheme, but is protected by a deposit protection scheme, or other scheme of a similar nature, established and maintained in the jurisdiction in which the bank is incorporated or domiciled; and (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 264)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: of the following information about the scheme—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the name, address, telephone number and website (if any) of the organization operating the scheme;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the scope and level of protection available to the deposits under the scheme;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the type of deposits protected by the scheme; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: any other information about the scheme, if any, as specified for this purpose in the conditions of the exemption.

subsection.leadIn: If a bank contravenes subsection (10), every director and every chief executive of the bank commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

def.name: RelevantTime
def.leadIn: In subsection (10), relevant time (有關時間)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in relation to a person who is not already a depositor of the bank but has informed the bank that he intends to make a deposit with the bank, means the time when the person so informs the bank.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Establishment of Deposit Protection Scheme Fund

subsection.content: There is established by this section a fund to be known as the “Deposit Protection Scheme Fund” in English and “存款保障計劃基金” in Chinese.

subsection.leadIn: The Fund is to consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: contributions and late payment fees collected from Scheme members;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: money recovered by the Board from, or out of the assets of, Scheme members;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: returns on investments made under section 21;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: money borrowed by the Board for the purpose of performing its functions; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other money lawfully paid into the Fund.

subsection.content: The Board shall assess the amount of contribution payable by each Scheme member.
As soon as practicable after having made an assessment under subsection (1), the Board shall notify the Scheme member of the assessment in writing.
A Scheme member shall pay to the Board, in the prescribed manner and within the prescribed period, the amount of contribution assessed by the Board.

subsection.leadIn: If a Scheme member fails to pay any contribution in contravention of subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Board may impose on the Scheme member a late payment fee of $5,000, or of a sum equivalent to 10% of the amount of the contribution that remains to be paid by the Scheme member, whichever is the greater; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Scheme member shall pay to the Board the contribution that remains to be paid by it, and the late payment fee, in the prescribed manner and within a period specified by the Board.

subsection.content: The Board shall, on collecting any contribution or late payment fee from a Scheme member, pay it into the Fund.

subsection.leadIn: If a Scheme member contravenes subsection (4)(b), every director and every chief executive of the Scheme member commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: Schedule 4 has effect with respect to the contributions payable by a Scheme member and to rebates and refunds of contributions.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Payments from Fund
section.leadIn: There shall be paid from the Fund, as required under this Ordinance, the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: expenses incurred—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in investigating or deciding the entitlement of depositors and other persons to compensation under Division 2 of Part 5;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in relation to the Scheme;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in the exercise by the Board of the rights, powers and authorities vested in it by this Ordinance or rules made under section 51;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: expenses incurred in—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the establishment and maintenance of the Scheme;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the management and administration of the Fund;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: expenses incurred in obtaining insurance, sureties, guarantees or other security, or in making any financial arrangement, in respect of any compensation paid under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: repayment of, and interest on, any money borrowed by the Board for the purpose of performing its functions;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: such amounts of compensation as allowed under this Ordinance, and the costs of and incidental to paying the same;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: such amounts of rebates and refunds of contributions as allowed under this Ordinance, and the costs of and incidental to paying the same;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: expenses incurred by or in relation to the Tribunal;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: any other money payable from the Fund in accordance with this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Board may, with the prior approval of the Financial Secretary, fix a period to be the financial year of the Fund.

As soon as practicable after the commencement* of this section, the Board shall submit to the Financial Secretary, for his approval, estimates of the income and expenditure of the Fund for the first financial year of the Fund.

In each financial year of the Fund, before a date to be fixed by the Financial Secretary, the Board shall submit to the Financial Secretary, for his approval, estimates of the income and expenditure of the Fund for the next financial year of the Fund.
The Board shall keep and maintain proper accounts and records of all transactions of the Fund.

subsection.leadIn: After the end of each financial year of the Fund, the Board shall cause to be prepared for the financial year a statement of accounts of the Fund that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: includes an income and expenditure account and balance sheet; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is signed by the Chairman of the Board.

subsection.content: The Board shall, with the prior approval of the Financial Secretary, appoint an auditor, who may be the Director of Audit.

subsection.leadIn: The auditor is entitled—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to have access to such books of account and other records of the Fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to require such information and explanation,

subsection.continued: as he considers necessary to perform his functions.

subsection.content: The auditor shall audit the statement of accounts prepared under section 18(2) and make a report to the Board on the audit of that statement.

A report made under subsection (3) shall contain a statement by the auditor as to whether in his opinion the statement of accounts gives a true and fair view of the matters to which the statement of accounts relates.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Statements and reports to be laid before Legislative Council

subsection.leadIn: The Board shall, within 4 months after the end of each financial year of the Fund or such further time as the Financial Secretary may for any particular year allow, submit to the Financial Secretary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a report on the activities of the Board for that financial year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the statement of accounts prepared under section 18(2) for that financial year; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a copy of the report made under section 19(3) on the audit of that statement.

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary shall cause the reports and statement received by him under subsection (1) to be laid on the table of the Legislative Council.

subsection.leadIn: The Board may place, or invest, money of the Fund that is not immediately required by the Board for the performance of its functions in the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: deposits with the Monetary Authority for the account of the Exchange Fund;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Exchange Fund Bills;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: US Treasury Bills;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), exchange rate contracts or interest rate contracts, including derivative products;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other investment approved by the Financial Secretary.

subsection.content: The Board shall not place, or invest, money of the Fund in exchange rate contracts or interest rate contracts except for hedging purposes.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to section 24, a specified event has occurred in relation to a Scheme member if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a winding-up order has been made by the Court of First Instance in respect of the Scheme member; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Monetary Authority has served on the Board a notice of his decision in respect of the Scheme member under subsection (2),

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to a date of the specified event, in relation to a Scheme member, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if a specified event has occurred in relation to the Scheme member by virtue of paragraph (a)(i), the date on which the winding-up order in respect of the Scheme member is made;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if a specified event has occurred in relation to the Scheme member by virtue of paragraph (a)(ii), the date on which the notice is served on the Board under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of a Scheme member—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a Manager within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) has been appointed under section 52 of that Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a provisional liquidator has been appointed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Monetary Authority is of the opinion that the Scheme member—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is likely to become unable to meet its obligations;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is about to suspend payment to its depositors; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: is insolvent, has ceased to pay its debts in the ordinary course of business, or cannot pay its debts as they become due,

subsection.continued: the Monetary Authority may, after consultation with the Financial Secretary, decide that compensation should be paid from the Fund to the depositors of the Scheme member in accordance with this Ordinance and shall thereupon serve on the Board a written notice of the Monetary Authority’s decision.

subsection.content: In the absence of evidence to the contrary, the Monetary Authority is deemed to have served on the Board a notice under subsection (2) if the notice has been left at the Board’s address in Hong Kong.
The Monetary Authority shall publish in the Gazette a copy of any notice served on the Board under subsection (2).

If a specified event has occurred in relation to a Scheme member, the Board may exempt in writing the Scheme member, in whole or in part as specified in the exemption, from section 15 and from rules made under section 51.

subsection.leadIn: If a specified event has occurred in relation to a Scheme member by virtue of subsection (1)(a)(ii), the fact that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case where subsection (2)(a)(i) applies in relation to the occurrence, the appointment of the Manager is reversed by the Chief Executive in Council under section 53(1)(i) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) or is set aside by a court; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case where subsection (2)(a)(ii) applies in relation to the occurrence, the order appointing the provisional liquidator is discharged,

subsection.continued: does not affect the operation of subsection (1)(a)(ii) in relation to the Scheme member.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Monetary Authority to report to Chief Executive in Council on occurrence of specified event

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Monetary Authority shall, as soon as practicable after a specified event has occurred, report the occurrence to the Chief Executive in Council.

subsection.leadIn: If a specified event has occurred in relation to a Scheme member by virtue of section 22(1)(a)(ii), the Monetary Authority shall, before reporting the occurrence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case where the Scheme member is incorporated in Hong Kong or is a re-domiciled entity— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 265)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: give the Scheme member not less than 7 days’ notice in writing (or such lesser period as is permitted under subsection (3)) informing the Scheme member of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: his decision under section 22(2) that compensation should be paid to the depositors of the Scheme member; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the reasons for his decision;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: afford the Scheme member an opportunity to submit to him representations in writing on the decision and reasons within the period of the notice; and

subparagraph.name: iii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case where the Scheme member is incorporated outside Hong Kong and is not a re-domiciled entity— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 265)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: give the Scheme member, at its principal place of business outside Hong Kong, not less than 7 days’ notice in writing (or such lesser period as is permitted under subsection (3)) informing the Scheme member of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: his decision under section 22(2) that compensation should be paid to the depositors of the Scheme member; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the reasons for his decision;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: afford the Scheme member an opportunity to submit to him representations in writing on the decision and reasons within the period of the notice; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: incorporate his decision, the reasons for his decision, and the Scheme member’s representations, if any, in his report to the Chief Executive in Council.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may give a Scheme member less than 7 days’ notice in writing referred to in subsection (2) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he has the consent of the Financial Secretary to do so; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to do so is reasonable in the circumstances.

subsection.content: If a specified event has occurred in relation to a Scheme member by virtue of section 22(1)(a)(ii), the Chief Executive in Council shall, as soon as practicable after receipt of the Monetary Authority’s report on the occurrence, by notice in writing given to the Monetary Authority confirm or revoke the Monetary Authority’s decision under section 22(2) that compensation should be paid to the depositors of the Scheme member.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether to confirm or revoke under subsection (4) the Monetary Authority’s decision, the Chief Executive in Council shall have regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the interests of the depositors of the Scheme member;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the general stability and effective working of the banking system in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: such other factors as the Chief Executive in Council considers appropriate in the public interest.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Specified event deemed never occurred under certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a specified event has occurred in relation to a Scheme member by virtue of section 22(1)(a)(i); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the winding-up order in respect of the Scheme member is set aside by a court,

subsection.continued: it is deemed, with effect on and after the date on which the setting aside takes effect, that the specified event never occurred.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a specified event has occurred in relation to a Scheme member by virtue of section 22(1)(a)(ii); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Monetary Authority’s decision under section 22(2) that compensation should be paid to the depositors of the Scheme member—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is revoked by the Chief Executive in Council under section 23(4); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is set aside by a court,

subsection.continued: it is deemed, with effect on and after the date specified in the notice of revocation as the date on which the revocation takes effect, or the date on which the setting aside takes effect, that the specified event never occurred and that the Monetary Authority had never served on the Board a notice of that decision.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) or (2) does not operate to prejudice the legality and effect of anything done in accordance with this Ordinance pursuant to the specified event before the effective date referred to in that subsection.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Quantification date
section.def: quantification date (截算日), in relation to a Scheme member, means the date on which the specified event occurred in relation to the Scheme member under section 22(1).

section.name: s26
section.heading: Protected deposits to include portion thereof

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a protected deposit includes a portion of the deposit; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case where a reference to a protected deposit means a portion of the deposit by virtue of paragraph (a), a reference to a portion of that protected deposit means a sub-portion of that portion.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 31, a person is entitled, in respect of one or more protected deposits with a failed Scheme member that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person holds in his own right;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a depositor holds as a bare trustee for the person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a depositor holds in a client account for the person as the depositor’s client,

subsection.continued: to compensation of the specified amount from the Fund under section 28 or 29, but the total amount of compensation to which the person is so entitled in respect of the deposits concerned, subject to the specified provisions, is not to exceed $800,000, regardless of the number or amount of deposits. (Amended 19 of 2024 s. 4)

subsection.content: Subject to section 31, a person is entitled, in respect of one or more protected deposits with a failed Scheme member that the person holds as a trustee under one trust, to compensation of the specified amount from the Fund under section 30, but the total amount of compensation to which the person is so entitled in respect of the deposits held under that trust, subject to the specified provisions, is not to exceed $800,000, regardless of the number or amount of deposits. (Amended 19 of 2024 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: In subsections (1) and (2)—
subsection.def: specified amount (指明款額), in relation to compensation to which a person is entitled from the Fund, means the aggregate of—(a)the total amount of protected deposits to which the person is entitled as at the quantification date; and(b)the interest accrued on that amount calculated up to and including the quantification date; (Replaced 2 of 2016 s. 4. Amended 19 of 2024 s. 4)

def.name: SpecifiedProvisions
def.leadIn: specified provisions (指明條文) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 27B; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 12 of Schedule 4 to the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628). (Added 19 of 2024 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of the definition of specified amount in subsection (3)— (Amended 19 of 2024 s. 4)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if any protected deposit is not denominated in Hong Kong dollars, the deposit is to be converted into Hong Kong dollars at the midpoint between the selling and buying telegraphic transfer rates of exchange quoted by HKAB on the quantification date or, where no such rates are quoted, at an exchange rate determined by the Board; and (Amended 2 of 2016 s. 4)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the Board may determine the amount of interest accrued on deposits by making an estimate that is reasonable and appropriate in the circumstances of the case if the Board considers that— (Amended 2 of 2016 s. 4)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: there is uncertainty as to the entire amount of interest so accrued;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the time required to ascertain the entire amount of interest so accrued would be so long as to unduly delay the payment of compensation to the person entitled to the compensation; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the costs and expenses that would be incurred in the calculation made to ascertain the entire amount of interest so accrued would, having regard to the likely difference between the ascertained amount and the estimated amount of the interest, outweigh the benefits of making the calculation. (Added 11 of 2010 s. 4)

subsection.content: This section applies in relation to the interpretation of this section and sections 27B and 27C.

subsection.leadIn: In this section and sections 27B and 27C—

def.name: MaterialDate
def.leadIn: material date (關鍵日期), in relation to a qualifying arrangement, means the date on which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the arrangement takes effect; and

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: qualifying arrangement (合資格安排)—see subsection (3);
resulting Scheme member (承轉方計劃成員)—see subsection (3);
transferor (轉讓方)—see subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: An arrangement (whether a merger, an acquisition or any other similar transaction) is a qualifying arrangement to which section 27B applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it involves the transfer (other than by way of an excluded transfer), on the date on which the arrangement takes effect, of protected deposits maintained with any of the parties to the arrangement that is a Scheme member (transferor) to another party to the arrangement (resulting Scheme member) to become protected deposits maintained with the resulting Scheme member; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the resulting Scheme member remains, or becomes, a Scheme member on that date.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section and section 27B, a person maintains a protected deposit with a Scheme member if the deposit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is held, in an account opened with the Scheme member, by the person in the person’s own right;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is held, in an account opened with the Scheme member, by a depositor as a bare trustee for the person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is held, in an account opened with the Scheme member, by a depositor in a client account for the person as the depositor’s client; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is held, in an account opened with the Scheme member, by the person as a trustee under one trust.

section.name: s27B
section.heading: Time-limited enhanced protection limit following qualifying arrangement of Scheme members

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a qualifying arrangement takes effect and the material date of the arrangement falls on or after 1 January 2025;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the protected deposits maintained with the transferor (original deposits) are transferred, under the qualifying arrangement, to the resulting Scheme member on the material date; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: during the enhanced protection period for the affected person, the resulting Scheme member becomes a failed Scheme member.

subsection.content: For determining the entitlement of the affected person to compensation under section 27(1) or (2) (as the case requires) in respect of the protected deposits the person maintains with the resulting Scheme member, that section applies to the person with the modification that the reference to “$800,000” is to be construed as a reference to “the enhanced protection limit”.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(d), the enhanced protection period, in relation to the affected person, is the period beginning on the material date of the qualifying arrangement and ending on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (b) and (c)—the expiry of 6 months beginning on the material date (6 months period);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the original deposits contain a deposit with the original maturity date falling after the 6 months period—that maturity date; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the original deposits contain 2 or more deposits with the original maturity dates falling after the 6 months period—the latest maturity date.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), the enhanced protection limit as at the quantification date, in relation to the affected person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraph (b), is the aggregate of—

subparagraph.leadIn: an additional amount for every transferor with which the person maintained any protected deposits immediately before the material date of the qualifying arrangement that is equivalent to—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: if the total amount of such deposits plus the interest accrued on that amount calculated up to and including the material date are less than $800,000—the sum of that total amount and the interest; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if the total amount of such deposits plus the interest accrued on that amount calculated up to and including the material date are not less than $800,000—$800,000,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if subsection (3)(b) or (c) applies and the quantification date falls after the 6 months period, is the aggregate of—

subparagraph.leadIn: an additional amount for every transferor with which the person maintained any protected deposits immediately before the material date of the qualifying arrangement that is equivalent to—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: if the total amount of such deposits with the original maturity dates falling after the 6 months period (which have not yet matured on the quantification date) plus the interest accrued on that amount calculated up to and including the material date are less than $800,000—the sum of that total amount and the interest; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if the total amount of such deposits with the original maturity dates falling after the 6 months period (which have not yet matured on the quantification date) plus the interest accrued on that amount calculated up to and including the material date are not less than $800,000—$800,000,

paragraph.continued: regardless of the number or amount of deposits the person maintained with the resulting Scheme member during the enhanced protection period.

section.name: s27C
section.heading: Notice to depositors about enhanced protection

subsection.content: A Scheme member involved in a qualifying arrangement (whether as a resulting Scheme member or one of the transferors) must, on or before the material date, send to every depositor of the Scheme member affected by the qualifying arrangement a written notice of the qualifying arrangement in the manner, together with the information, specified by the Board.
The Scheme member must, on or before the material date, inform the Board of the qualifying arrangement in writing and provide the Board with a copy of the notice referred to in subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: If a Scheme member, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with subsection (2), every director and every chief executive of the Scheme member commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Entitlement to compensation: depositors in their own right

subsection.content: Subject to this Division, if a depositor of a protected deposit with a failed Scheme member holds the deposit in his own right, the depositor is entitled, in respect of the deposit as at the date of the specified event, to compensation from the Fund.

subsection.leadIn: If the depositor consists of 2 or more persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case where the persons carry on business in partnership, those persons are, for the purpose of entitlement to compensation from the Fund, a single and continuing body of persons as distinct from the persons who may from time to time be the members of the partnership;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, each of those persons is entitled, in respect of his share in the protected deposit as at the date of the specified event, to compensation from the Fund.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2)(b), each of the persons is deemed to have an equal share in the protected deposit unless the contrary is proved to the satisfaction of the Board.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Entitlement to compensation: bare trusts and client accounts

subsection.content: Subject to this Division, if a depositor of a protected deposit with a failed Scheme member holds the deposit as a bare trustee under a bare trust, the beneficiary, but not the depositor, is entitled, in respect of the deposit as at the date of the specified event, to compensation from the Fund.

Subject to this Division, if a depositor of a protected deposit with a failed Scheme member holds the deposit as a bare trustee under different bare trusts, the beneficiary of each of those trusts, but not the depositor, is entitled, in respect of the portion of the deposit held under the trust as at the date of the specified event, to compensation from the Fund.

Subject to this Division, if a depositor of a protected deposit with a failed Scheme member holds the deposit in a client account for a client, the client, but not the depositor, is entitled, in respect of the deposit as at the date of the specified event, to compensation from the Fund.

subsection.leadIn: If the beneficiary or client consists of 2 or more persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case where the persons carry on business in partnership, those persons are, for the purpose of entitlement to compensation from the Fund, a single and continuing body of persons as distinct from the persons who may from time to time be the members of the partnership;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, each of those persons is entitled, in respect of his share in the protected deposit as at the date of the specified event, to compensation from the Fund.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (4)(b), each of the persons is deemed to have an equal share in the protected deposit unless the contrary is proved to the satisfaction of the Board.

Subject to this Division, if a depositor of a protected deposit with a failed Scheme member holds the deposit as a trustee under a trust, the depositor is entitled, in respect of the deposit as at the date of the specified event, to compensation from the Fund as such trustee of the trust.

Subject to this Division, if a depositor of a protected deposit with a failed Scheme member holds the deposit as a trustee under different trusts, the depositor is entitled, in respect of each portion of the deposit held under each of those trusts as at the date of the specified event, to compensation from the Fund as such trustee of the trust.

If the depositor consists of 2 or more persons, those persons are, for the purpose of entitlement to compensation from the Fund, a single and continuing body of persons as distinct from the persons who may from time to time be the trustees.

If a depositor of a Scheme member or any other person is entitled, in respect of the depositor’s protected deposit with the Scheme member, to compensation under this Division, any such compensation shall be paid to the depositor, but not any other person, in accordance with this Ordinance.
No action to enforce any entitlement to compensation under this Division may be brought in any court unless the action is commenced within 5 years after the date of the specified event concerned.

If a person has, in respect of a protected deposit or portion thereof, been paid an amount of compensation out of the Investor Compensation Fund established under section 236 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) in respect of a claim for compensation made under rules made under Part XII of that Ordinance, no person is entitled, in respect of the deposit or that portion (as the case may be), to compensation under this Division.

If the Board has paid a depositor of a protected deposit the entire amount of compensation payable to the depositor in accordance with this Ordinance, no other person is entitled, in respect of the deposit, to compensation under this Division.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Payment of Compensation and Related Matters

section.name: s32
section.heading: Board’s duties and powers on occurrence of specified event

subsection.leadIn: If a specified event has occurred in relation to a Scheme member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Board shall as soon as practicable after the occurrence inform the depositors of the Scheme member by notice published in any daily newspaper in circulation in Hong Kong, or by other means the Board considers appropriate, of the occurrence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Board—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: may, for the purpose of performing its functions, require a depositor, or each depositor of a class of depositors, of the Scheme member to supply the Board with information and documents in support of the entitlement of the depositor or other persons to compensation under Division 2; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: shall thereupon inform the depositors concerned by notice published in any daily newspaper in circulation in Hong Kong, or by other means the Board considers appropriate, of the requirement.

subsection.leadIn: If a specified event has occurred in relation to a Scheme member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Board, or a person appointed as an agent of the Board or authorized by the Board under this Ordinance, may, for the purpose of the performance by the Board of its functions under this Ordinance, have access to the premises and records of the Scheme member; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: every director, chief executive, manager, employee or agent of the Scheme member, the liquidator or provisional liquidator of the Scheme member, or any person in possession of the records of the Scheme member, shall, subject to subsection (3)—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: provide such assistance to the Board, or such a person so appointed or authorized, as the Board or person may require for the exercise of the power under paragraph (a).

subsection.content: The Board shall not require the disclosure by a solicitor or counsel of any privileged communication, whether oral or written, made to or by him in that capacity.
Any person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (2)(b) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: If a specified event has occurred in relation to a Scheme member, the Board shall decide in accordance with this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether a depositor of the Scheme member or any other person is entitled, in respect of the depositor’s protected deposit with the Scheme member, to compensation under Division 2; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if he is, the amount of compensation to which he is entitled under Division 2.

subsection.content: In making a decision under subsection (5), the Board may rely on the records obtained from the Scheme member except to the extent of any manifest error that appears on the face of those records.

subsection.leadIn: The Board shall as soon as practicable after a decision has been made under subsection (5)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the depositor of its decision in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if applicable, pay the compensation, subject to section 35, to the depositor from the Fund.

subsection.name: 7A
subsection.content: Subject to subsection (7B), the Board may comply with subsection (7)(a) by issuing the notice to the depositor in hard copy form or in electronic form. (Added 2 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.name: 7B
subsection.leadIn: The Board must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have regard to the matters the Board considers relevant in the circumstances in deciding whether to issue to the depositor a notice in hard copy form or in electronic form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take reasonable steps to satisfy itself that a notice in electronic form will come to the attention of the depositor. (Added 2 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: Agent
def.leadIn: agent (代理人), in relation to a Scheme member, includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the bankers and solicitors of the Scheme member; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any persons, whether officers of the Scheme member or not, who are engaged as the auditors of the Scheme member;

subsection.def: in electronic form (電子形式) means in the form of an electronic record, being a record generated in digital form by an information system, which can be—(a)transmitted within an information system or from one information system to another; and(b)stored in an information system or other medium; (Added 2 of 2016 s. 5)
in hard copy form (印本形式) means in a paper form or similar form capable of being read; (Added 2 of 2016 s. 5)
manager (經理) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155);
records (紀錄), in relation to a Scheme member, includes books, accounts, records of transactions and information systems of the Scheme member.

subsection.content: In this section, any reference to a director, chief executive, manager, employee or agent of a Scheme member includes a person who has been but no longer is a director, chief executive, manager, employee or agent of the Scheme member.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Board’s powers in relation to arrangements designed to increase amount of compensation

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an arrangement has been entered into or carried out on or after the relevant date in relation to a protected deposit with a Scheme member except where the arrangement is one in pursuance of a legally enforceable obligation incurred prior to that date;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the arrangement has, or would have had but for this section, the effect of enabling a person to become entitled to an amount of compensation under Division 2, to which the person would otherwise not be entitled; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: it would be concluded, having regard to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the manner in which, and the circumstances under which, the arrangement was entered into or carried out;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the form and substance of the arrangement; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the result in relation to the operation of this Ordinance that, but for this section, would have been achieved by the arrangement,

paragraph.continued: that the arrangement was entered into or carried out for the sole or dominant purpose of enabling the person, either alone or in conjunction with other persons, to become entitled to an amount of compensation under Division 2, to which the person would otherwise not be entitled.

subsection.leadIn: The Board shall exercise its power under section 32(5)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as if the arrangement or any part thereof had not been entered into or carried out; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in such other manner as the Board considers appropriate to counteract the effect of the arrangement.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: arrangement (安排) includes an arrangement, transaction, operation or scheme whether or not such arrangement, transaction, operation or scheme is enforceable, or intended to be enforceable, by legal proceedings;

def.name: RelevantDate
def.leadIn: relevant date (有關日期), in relation to a Scheme member, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which a Manager within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) is appointed in respect of the Scheme member under section 52 of that Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the petition for the winding up of the Scheme member is presented,

section.name: s34
section.heading: Compensation in Hong Kong dollars
section.content: Compensation payable in accordance with this Ordinance shall be paid in Hong Kong dollars regardless of the currency in which the protected deposit concerned is denominated.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Maximum amount of compensation payable to a depositor
section.leadIn: The amount of compensation payable to a depositor of a failed Scheme member in accordance with this Ordinance is not to exceed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount in respect of which the depositor would, on the winding up of the failed Scheme member, be entitled to priority under section 265(1)(db) of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32); or (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where an estimate has been made under section 27(4)(d) as a result of which the specified amount of compensation to which the depositor is entitled as referred to in section 27(1) or (2) is greater than the amount referred to in paragraph (a), that specified amount subject to the limit prescribed in section 27(1) or (2). (Amended 2 of 2016 s. 6)Note—In section 35(b), the amount of compensation under section 27(1) or (2) is subject to the specified provisions as defined by section 27(3) (if those provisions apply). (Added 19 of 2024 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: If a specified event has occurred in relation to a Scheme member, and the Board considers that, in relation to a depositor of the Scheme member— (Amended 11 of 2010 s. 6)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is uncertainty as to the entire amount of compensation payable to the depositor in accordance with this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the time required to ascertain the entire amount of compensation payable to the depositor in accordance with this Ordinance would be so long as to unduly delay the payment of compensation to the depositor by the Board,

subsection.continued: the Board may make an interim payment of compensation to the depositor. (Amended 11 of 2010 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: The Board—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is to determine the amount of interim payment to be made to a depositor under subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may make interim payments of different amounts to different depositors or different classes of depositors under subsection (1),

subsection.continued: that the Board considers appropriate having regard to the matters that the Board thinks relevant in the circumstances, which may include the financial position of the depositor or depositors concerned. (Added 11 of 2010 s. 6)

subsection.content: If the amount of compensation paid, whether or not as an interim payment under section 36, to a depositor from the Fund is later found to be greater than the amount of compensation payable to the depositor in accordance with this Ordinance, the depositor shall repay the excess to the Board in a manner, and within a period, specified by the Board.

subsection.leadIn: If a depositor contravenes subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Board may impose on the depositor a late repayment fee of a sum not exceeding 5% of the amount of the excess that remains to be repaid by the depositor; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the depositor shall pay to the Board the late repayment fee in a manner, and within a period, specified by the Board.

subsection.leadIn: Such excess or late repayment fee as a depositor is required to repay or pay under this section is recoverable by the Board from the depositor as a debt due to the Board. The Board may, in relation to the excess or late repayment fee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine, if it considers uneconomical to do so, not to recover the same from the depositor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take such steps as it considers appropriate to recover the same from the depositor.

subsection.content: The Board shall, on collecting any such excess or late repayment fee from a depositor, pay it into the Fund.

For the purposes of subsection (1), a reference to the amount of compensation payable to the depositor in accordance with this Ordinance does not include, where an estimate has been made under section 27(4)(d) as a result of which the amount of compensation paid to the depositor (the paid amount) is greater than the amount of compensation that would have been paid to the depositor if the estimate had not been made (the reference amount), the difference between the paid amount and the reference amount. (Added 11 of 2010 s. 7. Amended 2 of 2016 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: If the Board makes a payment of compensation to a depositor of a Scheme member from the Fund—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (2) and despite any rule of law, the Board is subrogated, to the extent of the aggregate amount, to all the rights and remedies of the depositor in relation to all the depositor’s deposits with the Scheme member, in priority over—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the rights and remedies of the depositor in relation to those deposits; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the rights and remedies of any person who is subrogated, whether or not before the Board’s subrogation, to the rights and remedies mentioned in subparagraph (i); and (Replaced 2 of 2016 s. 8)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: until the Board has been reimbursed in full the aggregate amount, the depositor, or any person who is subrogated, whether or not before the Board’s subrogation, to the rights and remedies mentioned in paragraph (a)(i), has no right in bankruptcy or winding up or by legal proceedings or otherwise to receive in respect of those deposits any amount from, or out of the assets of, the Scheme member. (Amended 2 of 2016 s. 8)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Subsections (1B) and (1C) apply in relation to the recovery by the Board of a payment of compensation made to a depositor of a Scheme member from the Fund, whether or not the Scheme member is wound up. (Added 2 of 2016 s. 8)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: Without limiting section 37, the Board is entitled to recover from, or out of the assets of, the Scheme member the aggregate amount in accordance with subsection (1C). (Added 2 of 2016 s. 8)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1B), the following do not apply in relation to the rights and remedies of the depositor, to which the Board is subrogated, up to the aggregate amount—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any law relating to set off (including section 35 of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) or that section as applied under section 264 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32)); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any right or obligation (however arising) with regard to set off or that has the effect of set off. (Added 2 of 2016 s. 8)

subsection.content: The Board is not subrogated to any rights and remedies of the depositor in respect of compensation payable out of the Investor Compensation Fund established under section 236 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571).
The Board may maintain an action in respect of the rights and remedies of a depositor to which it is subrogated in the name of the depositor or in its own name.

For the avoidance of doubt, the rights and remedies of a depositor to which the Board is subrogated include the rights and remedies of the depositor in respect of so much of his deposits as the depositor would, on the winding up of the Scheme member, be entitled to priority under section 265(1)(db) of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32). (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, the net amount of a payment of compensation to a depositor accrues interest, at the rate set out in subsection (6), for the period beginning with the date of the payment and ending with— (Amended 2 of 2016 s. 8)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a winding-up order has been made by the Court of First Instance in respect of a Scheme member, the date of the winding-up order made by the Court of First Instance; (Replaced 14 of 2016 s. 186)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any other case, the date on which the Board receives full reimbursement in respect of the aggregate amount. (Amended 2 of 2016 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: The interest rate referred to in subsection (5) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the rate at which interest is for the time being payable in respect of a Hong Kong dollar savings account with deposit amount of $800,000, quoted by the note-issuing banks within the meaning of section 2 of the Legal Tender Notes Issue Ordinance (Cap. 65); or (Amended 11 of 2010 s. 8; 19 of 2024 s. 7)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if different rates are quoted by different note-issuing banks, the rate determined by the Board as the average of those rates.

subsection.name: 6A
subsection.content: This section applies to all the depositor’s deposits with the Scheme member, whether or not they are protected deposits. (Added 2 of 2016 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: AggregateAmount
def.leadIn: aggregate amount (合計總額) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the net amount; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any interest accrued on that amount calculated in accordance with subsection (5);

subsection.def: net amount (淨額), in relation to a payment of compensation made to a depositor of a Scheme member from the Fund, means the amount of the payment less the amount of excess, if any, that has been recovered by the Board from the depositor under section 37(3). (Replaced 2 of 2016 s. 8)

section.name: s39
section.heading: Reimbursement from provisional liquidator
section.content: The provisional liquidator of a failed Scheme member may, subject to the approval of the Court of First Instance, reimburse the Board out of the assets of the failed Scheme member for any amount of compensation paid to a depositor of the failed Scheme member from the Fund, together with any interest accrued thereon in accordance with section 38.

part.name: P6
part.heading: Review by Deposit Protection Appeals Tribunal

section.name: s40
section.heading: Establishment of Deposit Protection Appeals Tribunal

subsection.content: There is established by this section a tribunal to be known as the “Deposit Protection Appeals Tribunal” in English and “存款保障上訴審裁處” in Chinese.
The function of the Tribunal is to review a decision or assessment the subject of an application under section 41(1), (2) or (3).

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of reviewing a decision or assessment, the Tribunal is to consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chairman of the Tribunal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such number of persons, not being fewer than 2, from the panel referred to in subsection (5) as the Financial Secretary may, on the recommendation of the Chairman, appoint to be members of the Tribunal to review the decision or assessment.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive shall, on the recommendation of the Chief Justice, appoint a judge to be the Chairman of the Tribunal.
The Chief Executive shall appoint a panel of persons, not being public officers, whom he considers suitable for appointment under subsection (3)(b) to be members of the Tribunal.
The Chief Executive shall give notice of each appointment under subsections (4) and (5) by notice published in the Gazette.

The Chairman (except where the Chairman is a judge, or a deputy judge, of the Court of First Instance), or members, of the Tribunal may be paid, as a fee for their services, such amount as the Chief Executive considers appropriate. Those amounts payable to the Chairman shall be a charge on the general revenue, and those amounts payable to the members shall be a charge on the Fund.
Schedule 3 has effect with respect to the Tribunal.
Subject to this section and Schedule 3 and to rules made under section 52, the Chairman of the Tribunal may determine the procedures and practice of the Tribunal.

Where the Chief Executive considers appropriate, additional Tribunals may be established for the purposes of any reviews of decisions or assessments of the Board or of decisions of the Monetary Authority, whereupon the provisions of this or any other Ordinance shall apply, subject to necessary modifications, to each of such additional Tribunals (including appointment of the chairman and other members of, and all matters concerning, each of such additional Tribunals) as they apply to the Tribunal.

def.name: Judge
def.leadIn: In this section, judge (法官) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a judge, or a deputy judge, of the Court of First Instance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a former Justice of Appeal of the Court of Appeal; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a former judge, or a former deputy judge, of the Court of First Instance.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Review of decisions or assessments by Tribunal

subsection.content: Any person who is aggrieved by a decision of the Board under section 13(3)(b), (5)(b) or (8)(a), (b) or (d) or 32(5)(a) or (b) may apply to the Tribunal for a review of the decision.

If a Scheme member is dissatisfied with the Board’s assessment under section 15(1) of the amount of contribution payable by the Scheme member, the Scheme member may apply to the Tribunal for a review of the assessment, but nothing in this subsection empowers a Scheme member to apply for a review of the MA supervisory rating of the Scheme member.
Any person who is aggrieved by a decision specified in rules made under section 53 as a decision to which this section applies may apply to the Tribunal for a review of the decision.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (1) or (2) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to be made in writing by the applicant—

subparagraph.name: i
