subparagraph.content: if the application relates to a decision of the Board under section 13(3)(b) or (5)(b), within 30 days after receiving the notice of decision of the Board given under section 13(6);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the application relates to a decision of the Board under section 13(8)(a), (b) or (d), within 30 days after receiving the notice of the Board given under section 13(8);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the application relates to a decision of the Board under section 32(5)(a) or (b), within 30 days after receiving the notice of decision of the Board given under section 32(7)(a);

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: if the application relates to the Board’s assessment under section 15(1), within 30 days after receiving the notice of the assessment given under section 15(2),

paragraph.continued: or within a further time that the Tribunal may, in the circumstances of any particular case, think fit; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to state the grounds for the review.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (3) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be made in writing by the applicant within the time specified in rules made under section 53 as the time within which such an application is to be made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to state the grounds for the review.

subsection.leadIn: The Tribunal shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: deliver to the Board a copy of any application under subsection (1) or (2) that it has received; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: deliver to the Monetary Authority a copy of any application under subsection (3) that it has received.

subsection.content: An application under subsection (1), (2) or (3) does not suspend the decision or assessment to which the application relates.

As soon as practicable after receipt of a copy of an application delivered under subsection (6), the Board or the Monetary Authority shall forward a copy of the decision or assessment together with all other relevant papers to the Tribunal.

subsection.leadIn: On receipt of the copy of the decision or assessment, and of the papers, forwarded under subsection (8), the Tribunal shall review the decision or assessment in question and, after taking into account the stated grounds for the review, may make its determination to do the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: confirm, vary or set aside the decision or assessment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remit the matter to the Board or the Monetary Authority with any direction that it considers appropriate.

subsection.content: If the Tribunal sets aside a decision of the Board under section 13(3)(b) or (8)(d), the Tribunal may make such directions as it considers appropriate concerning the refund of the contribution that has been paid by the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: In reviewing a decision or assessment of the Board or a decision of the Monetary Authority, the Tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall afford the applicant, and the Board or the Monetary Authority, an opportunity of being heard; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may determine that any matter of fact has been established if it has been established on the basis of standard of proof applicable to civil proceedings in a court of law.

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after completing the review, the Tribunal shall deliver its determination under subsection (9)(a) or (b), with the reasons for its determination.

A determination made by the Tribunal shall be recorded in writing and signed by the Chairman of the Tribunal. The determination shall be registered in the Court of First Instance and shall be deemed to be an order of the Court upon registration.
The determination of the Tribunal is final and is not subject to appeal except on a point of law.

For the purposes of any proceedings in a court of law, a document purporting to be a determination of the Tribunal that is signed by the Chairman of the Tribunal shall, in the absence of proof to the contrary, be regarded as a determination of the Tribunal duly made, without proof of its making, or proof of signature, or proof that the person signing the determination was in fact the Chairman of the Tribunal.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to a review of a decision or assessment of the Board or a decision of the Monetary Authority, the Tribunal may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: receive and consider any material by way of oral evidence, written statements or documents, whether or not the material would be admissible in a court of law;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine the manner in which any such material is received;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by notice in writing signed by the Chairman of the Tribunal, require a person to attend before it and, subject to subsection (2), to give evidence and produce any article, record or document in his possession or control relating to the subject matter of the review;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: administer oaths;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: examine or cause to be examined on oath or otherwise a person attending before it and require the person to answer truthfully any question which the Tribunal considers appropriate for the purpose of the review;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: order a witness to provide evidence for the purpose of the review by affidavit;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: order a person not to publish or otherwise disclose any material produced to the Tribunal;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: prohibit the publication or disclosure of any material the Tribunal receives at any sitting, or any part of a sitting, that is held in camera;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: stay any of the proceedings in the review on such grounds and on such terms and conditions as it considers appropriate having regard to the interests of justice;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: determine the procedure to be followed in connection with the review;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: order that costs be paid to any party to the review or any person who is required to attend before it for the purpose of the review;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: hear an application for stay of proceedings for a review by the applicant at any time before its determination is made; and

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: exercise such other powers or make such other orders as may be necessary for or ancillary to the conduct of the review or the performance of its functions.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(c) does not empower the Tribunal to require—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the banker or financial adviser of an applicant to disclose any information relating to the affairs of any person other than the applicant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a solicitor or counsel to disclose any privileged communication, whether oral or written, made to or by him in that capacity.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if he, without reasonable excuse—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to comply with an order, notice, prohibition or requirement of the Tribunal made or given under or pursuant to subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having been required by the Tribunal under subsection (1)(c) to attend before the Tribunal, leaves the place where his attendance is so required without the permission of the Tribunal;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: hinders or deters any person from attending before the Tribunal, giving evidence or producing any article, record or document, for the purpose of a review;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: threatens, insults or causes any loss to be suffered by any person who has attended before the Tribunal, on account of such attendance; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: threatens, insults or causes any loss to be suffered by the Chairman, or any member, of the Tribunal at any time on account of the performance of his functions in that capacity.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (3) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: A person is not excused from complying with an order, notice, prohibition or requirement of the Tribunal made or given under or pursuant to subsection (1) only on the ground that to do so might tend to incriminate the person.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Use of incriminating evidence required by Tribunal
section.leadIn: Notwithstanding any other provisions of this Ordinance, where the Tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: requires a person to give evidence under section 42(1)(c);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: requires a person to answer any question under section 42(1)(e);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: orders a person to provide evidence under section 42(1)(f); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: otherwise requires or orders a person to provide any information under section 42(1)(m),

section.continued: and the evidence, answer or information might tend to incriminate the person, then the requirement or order as well as the evidence, the question and answer, or the information shall not be admissible in evidence against the person in criminal proceedings in a court of law other than those in which the person is charged with an offence under section 42(3)(a), or under Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200), or for perjury, in respect of the evidence, answer or information.

subsection.content: The Tribunal has the same powers as the Court of First Instance to punish for contempt.

Without limiting the generality of the powers of the Tribunal under subsection (1), the Tribunal has the same powers as the Court of First Instance to punish for contempt, as if it were contempt of court, a person who, without reasonable excuse, commits any conduct falling within section 42(3).

The Tribunal shall, in the exercise of its powers to punish for contempt under this section, adopt the same standard of proof as the Court of First Instance in the exercise of the same powers to punish for contempt.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding anything in this section or any other provisions of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: no power may be exercised under or pursuant to this section to determine whether to punish any person for contempt in respect of any conduct if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: criminal proceedings have previously been instituted against the person under section 42(3) in respect of the same conduct; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: those criminal proceedings remain pending; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: by reason of the previous institution of those criminal proceedings, no criminal proceedings may again be lawfully instituted against that person under that section in respect of the same conduct;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: no criminal proceedings may be instituted against any person under section 42(3) in respect of any conduct if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any power has previously been exercised under or pursuant to this section to determine whether to punish the person for contempt in respect of the same conduct; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: proceedings arising from the exercise of such power remain pending; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: by reason of the previous exercise of such power, no power may again be lawfully exercised under or pursuant to this section to determine whether to punish the person for contempt in respect of the same conduct.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Tribunal has delivered its determination under section 41(9)(a) or (b) on a review of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a decision or assessment of the Board; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a decision of the Monetary Authority,

subsection.continued: the applicant, or the Board or the Monetary Authority (as the case may be), if dissatisfied with the determination, may appeal to the Court of Appeal against the determination on a point of law.

subsection.leadIn: The Court of Appeal may, in relation to a determination appealed against, do the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: confirm, vary or set aside the determination;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remit the matter to the Tribunal with any direction that it considers appropriate.

subsection.content: The Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A) apply in relation to such an appeal to the extent that those Rules are not inconsistent with this Ordinance.
In an appeal under this section, the Court of Appeal may make such order for payment of costs as it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: Except so far as it is necessary for the performance of any function under this Ordinance or for carrying into effect the provisions of this Ordinance, a specified person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not suffer or permit any person to have access to any matter relating to the affairs of any person that comes to the specified person’s knowledge in the performance of any function under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not communicate any such matter to any person other than the person to whom such matter relates.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: in connection with any other legal proceedings arising out of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: to the disclosure of information with a view to the institution of, or otherwise for the purpose of, any disciplinary proceedings relating to the discharge of his professional duties by an auditor, or a former auditor, of a Scheme member or former Scheme member, whether or not the auditor or former auditor, as the case may be, was appointed for the purposes of section 48(3) or (4);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to the disclosure of information to the Chief Executive, the Financial Secretary, the Monetary Authority, the Securities and Futures Commission, an investor compensation company recognized by the Commission under section 79 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) or any public officer authorized by the Financial Secretary where the disclosure will, in the opinion of the Board, enable or assist the recipient of the information to perform his functions;

paragraph.name: g
ga
paragraph.content: to the disclosure of information by the Monetary Authority to a resolution authority for the purpose of enabling or assisting the resolution authority to perform its functions under the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628); (Added 23 of 2016 s. 224 and E.R. 2 of 2017)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: to the disclosure of information with the consent of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person from whom the information was obtained or received; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the information does not relate to such person, the person to whom it relates;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: to the disclosure of information which has been made available to the public by virtue of being disclosed in any circumstances in which, or for any purpose for which, disclosure is not precluded by this section; or

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: to the disclosure of information required by law.

subsection.leadIn: The Board may attach a condition to any disclosure of information made pursuant to subsection (2)(b), (c), (d), (e), (f) or (j), and shall attach a condition to any disclosure of information made pursuant to subsection (2)(g), that neither—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person to whom the information has been disclosed; nor

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person obtaining or receiving the information (whether directly or indirectly) from the person referred to in paragraph (a),

subsection.continued: shall disclose that information to any other person without the consent of the Board.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall, without the written consent of the Monetary Authority given generally or in any particular case or class of cases, disclose to any other person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any information regarding a Scheme member’s MA supervisory rating or the amount of a Scheme member’s contribution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other information that would, by itself or together with other information, enable a Scheme member’s MA supervisory rating or the amount of a Scheme member’s contribution to be ascertained or inferred.

subsection.leadIn: Any specified person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: If a person, knowing that the condition referred to in subsection (3) has been attached to a disclosure of information made pursuant to subsection (2), contravenes that condition, the person commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: If a person contravenes subsection (4), the person or, where the person is a Scheme member, every director and every chief executive of the person, commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

def.name: SpecifiedPerson
def.leadIn: In this section, specified person (指明人士) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any person who—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a member of the Board;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a related person of the Board; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: a person employed by or assisting a related person of the Board; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: performs or has performed any function under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority, or a person appointed under section 5A(3) of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66) to assist the Monetary Authority.

subsection.content: The Board, or a person who is, or is acting as, a member, or a related person, of the Board, is not liable for anything done, or omitted to be done, in good faith in the performance, or purported performance, of the functions of the Board.

The Monetary Authority, or a person appointed under section 5A(3) of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66) to assist the Monetary Authority, is not liable for anything done, or omitted to be done, in good faith in the performance, or purported performance, of the functions imposed on the Authority by or under this Ordinance.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Power of Board to obtain information

subsection.content: The Board may require a Scheme member to submit (including periodically submit) such information as it may require for the performance of its functions, and such information shall be submitted within such period and in such manner as the Board may specify.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1), the Board may require a Scheme member to submit, within such period and in such manner as the Board may require, returns showing— (Amended 11 of 2010 s. 9)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of relevant deposits, within the meaning of section 1 of Schedule 4, maintained with the Scheme member; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the breakdown of those relevant deposits. (Amended 11 of 2010 s. 9; 2 of 2016 s. 9)

subsection.content: The Board may require a Scheme member to submit a report prepared by an auditor appointed by the Scheme member and approved by the Board as to whether or not, in the opinion of the auditor, information submitted pursuant to subsection (1) or a return submitted pursuant to subsection (2), is correctly compiled in all material respects.

The Board may require a Scheme member to submit a report prepared by an auditor appointed by the Scheme member and approved by the Board as to whether or not, in the opinion of the auditor, the Scheme member has in place systems of control that are adequate to enable the Board to perform its functions.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in this section empowers the Board to require a Scheme member to submit any information or report relating to any person who is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a beneficiary for whom a deposit, or portion thereof, maintained with the Scheme member is held by a depositor as a trustee or bare trustee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a client for whom a deposit, or portion thereof, maintained with the Scheme member is held by a depositor in a client account.

subsection.leadIn: If a Scheme member, without reasonable excuse, fails to submit any information or return as required under subsection (1) or (2), every director and every chief executive of the Scheme member commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years and to a further fine of $20,000 for each day on which the failure continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months and to a further fine of $10,000 for each day on which the failure continues.

subsection.content: If a Scheme member, without reasonable excuse, fails to submit an auditor’s report as required under subsection (3) or (4), every director and every chief executive of the Scheme member commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to a further fine of $10,000 for each day on which the failure continues.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who signs any document to which subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4) relates and which he knows or reasonably ought to know to be false in a material particular commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: systems of control (管控制度) includes procedures.

section.name: s49
section.heading: False statements regarding Scheme membership and protected deposits

subsection.leadIn: No person shall, with intent to deceive, make any false, misleading or deceptive statement or representation as to whether or not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is a Scheme member; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a deposit, or any other financial product, is a protected deposit.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Defences
section.content: In any proceedings for an offence under section 13(11), 15(6), 27C(3), 46(7) or 48(6) or (7), it is a defence for the person charged to prove that he took reasonable precautions and exercised due diligence to avoid the commission of the offence by himself or any person under his control.

subsection.content: This section applies if a provision of this Ordinance that creates an offence makes a reference to a reasonable excuse for a contravention to which the provision relates.
The reference to a reasonable excuse is to be construed as providing for a defence to a charge in respect of the contravention to which the provision relates.

subsection.leadIn: A defendant is to be taken to have established that the defendant had a reasonable excuse for the contravention if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sufficient evidence is adduced to raise an issue that the defendant had such a reasonable excuse; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Power of Board to make rules

subsection.leadIn: The Board may, after consultation with the Financial Secretary and HKAB, make rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prescribing the requirements in accordance with which Scheme members shall maintain those information systems and other records to which the Board would, on the occurrence of a specified event, have access under section 32(2)(a);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribing the manner in which compensation is to be paid to depositors from the Fund;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: prescribing the manner in which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: contributions or late payment fees are to be paid by Scheme members; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: rebates or refunds of contributions are to be paid to Scheme members;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: requiring a Scheme member to make known to the public under specified circumstances that it is a member of the Scheme or will cease to be a member of the Scheme, and prescribing the manner in which the requirement is to be complied with; (Replaced 11 of 2010 s. 10)

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.leadIn: requiring a Scheme member—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to make known to the public under specified circumstances as to whether a deposit or any other financial product offered by the Scheme member is or is not a protected deposit; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to obtain under specified circumstances an acknowledgment from any person placing or holding a deposit with, or investing in or holding any other financial product offered by, the Scheme member of having received a notification from the Scheme member as to whether the deposit or financial product is or is not a protected deposit,

paragraph.continued: and prescribing the manner in which the requirement is to be complied with; (Added 11 of 2010 s. 10)

paragraph.name: db
paragraph.content: imposing restrictions on Scheme members relating to the descriptions or representations of any financial product as a deposit or a specified kind of deposit; (Added 11 of 2010 s. 10)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: prescribing anything required to be prescribed under this Ordinance other than Part 6 and section 5 of Schedule 3; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: generally providing for the better performance of the functions of the Board.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: provide that a contravention of a specified provision of the rules is an offence punishable—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: on conviction on indictment by a fine at level 6 and imprisonment for 2 years; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: on summary conviction by a fine at level 3 and imprisonment for 6 months; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide for any specified defence to be available in proceedings for such an offence.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section shall not require a Scheme member to maintain any information system or other records that contain information or documents, or to submit any information or document, relating to any person who is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a beneficiary for whom a deposit, or portion thereof, maintained with the Scheme member is held by a depositor as a trustee or bare trustee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a client for whom a deposit, or portion thereof, maintained with the Scheme member is held by a depositor in a client account.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Power of Chief Justice to make rules
section.leadIn: The Chief Justice may make rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: providing for matters of procedure, or other matters, relating to applications for review, or reviews, under Part 6, which are not provided for in that Part or section 5 of Schedule 3;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing for the issue or service of any document (however described) for the purposes of Part 6 or section 5 of Schedule 3; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: prescribing anything required to be prescribed under Part 6 or section 5 of Schedule 3.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Power of Monetary Authority to make rules

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, after consultation with HKAB, make rules for the purpose of enabling a Scheme member, or each Scheme member of a class of Scheme members, to be required to maintain, in respect of the relevant deposits maintained with the Scheme member, assets in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: empower the Monetary Authority to require a Scheme member, or each Scheme member of a class of Scheme members, to maintain, in respect of the relevant deposits maintained with the Scheme member, assets in Hong Kong in accordance with any requirement specified in the rules for the purpose;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: empower the Monetary Authority to specify, for the purpose of an asset maintenance requirement, the amount of assets to be maintained in Hong Kong by the Scheme member, or each of the Scheme members, subject to the requirement;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify the circumstances under which, and the manner in which, the Monetary Authority may issue an asset maintenance requirement;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: specify—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the assets that are to be regarded as assets in Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the extent to which, and the manner in which, certain assets are to be taken into account; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: other matters to be taken into account,

paragraph.continued: for the purpose of determining whether an asset maintenance requirement has been complied with;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: require that the Monetary Authority shall, before issuing an asset maintenance requirement, afford the Scheme member an opportunity of being heard;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: specify the time within which, and the manner in which, a Scheme member is to be heard before an asset maintenance requirement is issued;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: enable any person aggrieved by an asset maintenance requirement to apply to the Tribunal for a review of the decision;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: specify the time within which, and the manner in which, such an application is to be made;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.leadIn: provide that every director and every chief executive of a Scheme member that contravenes an asset maintenance requirement commits an offence and is liable—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $20,000 for each day during which the offence continues; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for each day during which the offence continues;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: provide for any specified defence to be available in proceedings for such an offence; and

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: provide for any other matter relating to the asset maintenance requirement.

subsection.def: In this section, asset maintenance requirement (維持資產規定) means the requirement, referred to in subsection (2)(a), by the Monetary Authority of a Scheme member, or each Scheme member of a class of Scheme members, to maintain assets in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1, 2, 3 or 4.
In amending Schedule 4, the Chief Executive in Council shall ensure that the Fund should, so far as practicable, be made up of money derived from the banking industry.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Transitional provisions in relation to Deposit Protection Scheme (Amendment) Ordinance 2010

subsection.content: The amendments made to this Ordinance by the Deposit Protection Scheme (Amendment) Ordinance 2010 (11 of 2010) (the amending Ordinance) do not apply if a specified event within the meaning of section 22(1) has occurred before the commencement* of section 4 of the amending Ordinance, in which case the limit on the total amount of compensation to which a depositor may be entitled is the limit prescribed in section 27 before it is amended by that section 4 even though the payment of compensation is made after the commencement of that section 4.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under section 51(1)(da) as added by section 10(2) of the amending Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may provide that any requirement imposed by those rules applies in relation to a deposit or any other financial product that is in existence at the commencement of those rules; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may prescribe the manner in which the requirement in relation to the deposit or financial product is to be complied with.

subsection.content: Rules made under section 51(1)(db) as added by section 10(3) of the amending Ordinance may provide that those rules, in so far as they relate to the imposition of restrictions on Scheme members relating to the descriptions or representations of any financial product as a structured deposit, do not have effect in relation to any financial product that was being described or represented as a structured deposit immediately before the commencement of those rules.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Transitional provisions in relation to Deposit Protection Scheme (Amendment) Ordinance 2016

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: former Ordinance (《原有條例》) means this Ordinance as in force immediately before the commencement date;
specified event (指明事件) means a specified event within the meaning of section 22(1).

subsection.content: The former Ordinance applies to all matters arising from, in relation to, or as a consequence of, a specified event that has occurred before the commencement date.

subsection.leadIn: The provisions of the former Ordinance specified in subsection (4) continue to apply—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: for calculating the amount of contribution payable by a new Scheme member under section 6(1) of that Schedule for the year of 2016.

subsection.leadIn: The provisions of the former Ordinance specified for the purposes of subsection (3) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 48(2);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the definition of amount of relevant deposits in section 1(1) of Schedule 4; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 1(2) of that Schedule.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Transitional provisions in relation to Deposit Protection Scheme (Amendment) Ordinance 2024

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: amending Ordinance (《修訂條例》) means the Deposit Protection Scheme (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (19 of 2024);
*commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which section 4(2) and (4) of the amending Ordinance comes into operation;
pre-amended Ordinance (《原有條例》) means this Ordinance as in force immediately before the commencement date;
specified event (指明事件) means a specified event within the meaning of section 22(1).

subsection.content: The amendments made to this Ordinance by the amending Ordinance do not apply if a specified event has occurred before 1 October 2024, in which case the limit on the total amount of compensation to which a person may be entitled is the limit prescribed in section 27 (that is, $500,000) before it is amended by section 4(2) and (4) of the amending Ordinance even though the payment of compensation is made after the commencement date.

The definition of amount of relevant deposits in section 1(1) of Schedule 4 to the pre-amended Ordinance continues to apply for calculating the amount of contribution payable by a new Scheme member under section 6(1) of Schedule 4 for the year of 2024.

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.heading: Deposits Specified for Purposes of Definitions of Protected Deposit and Relevant Deposit in Section 2(1) of this Ordinance

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: For the purpose of the definition of protected deposit in section 2(1) of this Ordinance, the following deposits are specified—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a term deposit where the current term agreed to by the depositor at the most recent time it was negotiated exceeds 5 years;

paragraph.name: aa
b
paragraph.content: a deposit the repayment of which is secured either in whole or in part on the assets of the Scheme member;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a bearer instrument;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a deposit taken by the Scheme member at any of its offices outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a deposit held for the account of the Exchange Fund;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a deposit held by an excluded person in his own right, or, in the case of a deposit held by an excluded person and a non-excluded person in their own right (except where those persons carry on business in partnership), the portion of the deposit attributable to the excluded person’s share in the deposit;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a deposit held by a depositor as a bare trustee for an excluded person, or in a client account for an excluded person as the depositor’s client, or, in the case of a deposit so held for an excluded person and a non-excluded person (except where those persons carry on business in partnership), the portion of the deposit attributable to the excluded person’s share in the deposit;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a deposit held by a depositor as a trustee for an excluded person only; (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 67)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: any float or SVF deposit held by a depositor with a Scheme member; (Added 18 of 2015 s. 67. Amended 17 of 2025 s. 176)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a deposit comprising reserve assets as defined by section 2(1) of the Stablecoins Ordinance (17 of 2025), held by a depositor with a Scheme member. (Added 17 of 2025 s. 176)

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: For the purpose of the definition of relevant deposit in section 2(1) of this Ordinance, the following deposits are specified—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a term deposit where the current term agreed to by the depositor at the most recent time it was negotiated exceeds 5 years;

paragraph.name: aa
b
paragraph.content: a deposit the repayment of which is secured either in whole or in part on the assets of the Scheme member;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a bearer instrument;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a deposit taken by the Scheme member at any of its offices outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a deposit held for the account of the Exchange Fund;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a deposit held by an excluded person in his own right, or, in the case of a deposit held by an excluded person and a non-excluded person in their own right (except where those persons carry on business in partnership), the portion of the deposit attributable to the excluded person’s share in the deposit.

section.name: s2A
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule, a deposit is a structured deposit if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the loan of money, or any part of the loan, may be repaid—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in another currency to be converted, at an exchange rate specified in terms of a ratio at the time when the loan of money was made, from the currency in which that loan was made; or (Replaced L.N. 175 of 2006)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the form of any property other than money;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the interest on the loan of money, or the premium at which the loan of money is repayable, or any part of the interest or premium, may be paid in another currency to be converted, at an exchange rate specified in terms of a ratio at the time when the loan of money was made, from the currency in which that loan was made; (Amended L.N. 175 of 2006)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: any amount of the loan of money to be repaid is determined by reference to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the price or value of a financial product, commodity, non-local currency or property;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the level of an index;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: the fact that a relevant figure—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is above, below or equal to a specified level; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: is within or outside a specified range;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the difference calculated by subtracting a relevant figure from a specified percentage;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the result of a mathematical operation that involves more than one relevant figure; or

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: the occurrence or non-occurrence of an event in relation to a person other than the depositor who holds, or the Scheme member that takes, the deposit; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: any amount of the interest on the loan of money, or of the premium at which the loan of money is repayable, is determined by reference to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the price or value of a financial product, commodity, non-local currency or property;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the level of an index;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: the fact that a relevant figure—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is above, below or equal to a specified level; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: is within or outside a specified range;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the difference calculated by subtracting a relevant figure from a specified percentage;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the result of a mathematical operation that involves more than one relevant figure; or

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: the occurrence or non-occurrence of an event in relation to a person other than the depositor who holds, or the Scheme member that takes, the deposit.

section.name: s3
section.def: commodity (商品) means any item which is listed in the Schedule to the Commodity Exchanges (Prohibition) Ordinance (Cap. 82); (Added L.N. 107 of 2006)

def.name: ExcludedPerson
def.leadIn: excluded person (豁除人士), in relation to a deposit maintained with a Scheme member, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a related company of the Scheme member;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a multilateral development bank as defined in section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155); (Amended 19 of 2005 s. 7)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an authorized institution;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a foreign bank; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: in relation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: to the definition of protected deposit in section 2(1) of this Ordinance for the purposes of Part 5 of this Ordinance, an officer of the Scheme member or its related company on—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the date immediately preceding the date on which a Manager within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) is appointed in respect of the Scheme member under section 52 of that Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the date on which the petition for the winding up of the Scheme member is presented,

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to the definition of protected deposit in section 2(1) of this Ordinance for any other purpose, an officer of the Scheme member or its related company; (Amended L.N. 107 of 2006)

section.def: financial product (金融產品) means any securities, futures contract, collective investment scheme or leveraged foreign exchange contract within the meaning of section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); (Added L.N. 107 of 2006)
float (儲值金額) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance (Cap. 584); (Added 18 of 2015 s. 67)

def.name: ForeignBank
def.leadIn: foreign bank (外地銀行) means a company that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is incorporated outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not an authorized institution; and

paragraph.name: c

def.name: NonexcludedPerson
def.leadIn: non-excluded person (非豁除人士) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to the definition of protected deposit in section 2(1) of this Ordinance for the purposes of Part 5 of this Ordinance, a person who is not an excluded person within the meaning of paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d) or (e)(i) of the definition of excluded person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to the definition of protected deposit in section 2(1) of this Ordinance for any other purpose, a person who is not an excluded person within the meaning of paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d) or (e)(ii) of the definition of excluded person; (Amended L.N. 107 of 2006)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to the definition of relevant deposit in section 2(1) of this Ordinance, a person who is not an excluded person within the meaning of paragraph (a), (b), (c) or (d) of the definition of excluded person; (Added L.N. 107 of 2006)

def.name: Officer
def.leadIn: officer (人員)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a Scheme member or its related company that is an authorized institution, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a director of the Scheme member or the company;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a chief executive of the Scheme member or the company;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a controller, within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155), of the Scheme member or the company; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a manager, within the meaning of that section, of the Scheme member or the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a Scheme member’s related company that is not an authorized institution, has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

def.name: RelatedCompany
def.leadIn: related company (關連公司), in relation to a Scheme member, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a holding company of the Scheme member;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a subsidiary of the holding company; or

paragraph.name: c

def.name: RelevantFigure
def.leadIn: relevant figure (有關數字) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a rate of interest, quoted or published from time to time, that is offered by a person or government on a loan of money that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person or government makes to, or proposes to make to, another person or government; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the person or government raises from, or proposes to raise from, another person or government;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a rate of interest, quoted or published from time to time, that is offered by a person or government, for entering into a swap contract with another person or government, as the rate of interest at which payments to be made under that contract are to be calculated;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a rate of return, quoted or published from time to time, on an investment of moneys made by a person or government; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a figure, quoted or published from time to time, that represents the result of a mathematical operation that involves more than one rate of interest or return mentioned in paragraph (a), (b) or (c); (Added L.N. 107 of 2006)

section.def: SVF deposit (工具按金) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance (Cap. 584); (Added 18 of 2015 s. 67)

swap contract (掉期合約) means a contract made between two parties whereby each party agrees to make payments, calculated at a rate of interest on a specified amount of money, to the other party in a particular period. (Added L.N. 107 of 2006)

section.name: s4
section.content: For the purposes of sections 1(f) and (g) and 2(f), if a deposit is held by more than one person in their own right or held for more than one person, each of those persons is deemed to have an equal share in the deposit unless the contrary is proved to the satisfaction of the Board.

subsection.content: The affixing of the common seal of the Board shall be authenticated by the signature of any 2 members of the Board.
Any document purporting to be a document duly executed under the seal of the Board shall be received in evidence and is, unless the contrary is proved, to be deemed to be a document so executed.
An appointed member of the Board shall be appointed for a term not exceeding 3 years.
On the expiry of his period of appointment or reappointment, an appointed member of the Board is eligible for reappointment for such further term as the Chief Executive may specify.

An appointed member of the Board may resign from office by giving notice in writing to the Chief Executive. A notice of resignation takes effect on the date specified in the notice or, if no date is specified, on the date of receipt by the Chief Executive of the notice.

If the Chairman of the Board is, due to absence from Hong Kong or for any other reason, unable to perform the functions of his office as Chairman, the Chief Executive may appoint another appointed member of the Board to be the temporary Chairman in his place during his incapacity. (Amended 11 of 2010 s. 12)

If an appointed member of the Board (other than the Chairman) is, due to absence from Hong Kong or for any other reason, unable to perform the functions of his office as member, the Chief Executive may appoint another person to be a temporary member in his place during his incapacity. (Amended 11 of 2010 s. 12)
If a person is appointed as the temporary Chairman, or a temporary member, of the Board, the person may perform all the functions of the Chairman, or member, in whose place the person is appointed.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Terms and conditions of appointment of members
section.content: All matters relating to the terms and conditions of the appointment of the members (other than ex officio members) of the Board are to be determined by the Chief Executive.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Removal of appointed members
section.leadIn: If the Chief Executive is satisfied that an appointed member of the Board—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: has become—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a public officer; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: a director or an employee of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: an authorized institution;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a holding company of an authorized institution;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: a subsidiary of such a holding company; or

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: a subsidiary of an authorized institution,

subsection.content: Meetings of the Board are to be held at such times and places, and in such manner (including by electronic means), as the Chairman of the Board may decide. (Amended 11 of 2010 s. 12)
The quorum for a meeting of the Board is 4 members present at the meeting. (Amended 11 of 2010 s. 12)
Subject to the provisions of this Schedule, the Board may determine its own procedures.

subsection.leadIn: At a meeting of the Board—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chairman of the Board shall preside;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each member of the Board present has one vote; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: every question for decision shall be determined by a majority of votes of the members of the Board present and, in the case of an equality of votes, the Chairman of the Board has a casting vote.

subsection.leadIn: A member of the Board is to be regarded as being present at a meeting of the Board, even though the member does not attend the meeting in person, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the member participates in the meeting by telephone, video conferencing or other electronic means; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the member is able to communicate with the other members attending or participating in the meeting and they are able to communicate with that member. (Added 11 of 2010 s. 12)

subsection.content: A member who participates in a meeting of the Board by telephone, video conferencing or other electronic means may cast a vote by the same electronic means. (Added 11 of 2010 s. 12)
Subsection (4)(a) and (c) applies even though the Chairman of the Board participates in the meeting by telephone, video conferencing or other electronic means. (Added 11 of 2010 s. 12)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Transaction of business by circulation of papers

subsection.content: The Board may transact any of its business by circulation of papers.

A resolution in writing which is approved in writing by a majority of the members of the Board is as valid and effectual as if it had been duly passed at a meeting of the Board by the votes of the members of the Board so approving the resolution.
A facsimile or an electronically transmitted document that bears the signature of a member of the Board is to be regarded as having been approved in writing by that member.
To avoid doubt, a reference to circulation of papers in this section includes circulation of information by electronic means.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Committees
section.leadIn: The Board may appoint committees for any general or special purposes as it thinks fit and, in relation to such a committee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairman shall be appointed by the Board; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the chairman and at least two-thirds of the other members are to be members of the Board.

subsection.content: A member of the Board who is in any way directly or indirectly interested in a contract made or proposed to be made by the Board, shall disclose the nature of his interest at a meeting of the Board. The disclosure shall be recorded in the minutes of the Board, and the member may not without the permission of the Chairman of the Board take any part in any deliberation of the Board with respect to that contract and may not in any event vote on any question concerning it.

For the purposes of subsection (1), a general notice given at a meeting of the Board by a member of the Board to the effect that he is a member of a specified company or firm and is to be regarded as interested in any contract that may, after the date of the notice, be made with the company or firm is regarded as a sufficient disclosure of his interest in relation to any contract so made or proposed to be so made.

A member of the Board need not attend in person at a meeting of the Board in order to make a disclosure which he is required to make under subsection (1) if he takes reasonable steps to secure that the disclosure is made by a notice which is brought up and read at the meeting.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: panel member (小組成員) means a member of the panel referred to in section 40(5) of this Ordinance;

def.name: Parties
def.leadIn: parties (各方)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a review of a decision or assessment of the Board, means the applicant or the Board;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a review of a decision of the Monetary Authority, means the applicant or the Monetary Authority;

section.def: Tribunal member (審裁處成員) means a member of the Tribunal appointed under section 40(3)(b) of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Chairman of the Tribunal shall be appointed for a term not exceeding 3 years or appointed to act in relation to any specified review.
On the expiry of his period of appointment or reappointment, the Chairman of the Tribunal is eligible for reappointment.

The Chairman of the Tribunal may resign from office by giving notice in writing to the Chief Executive. A notice of resignation takes effect on the date specified in the notice or, if no date is specified, on the date of receipt by the Chief Executive of the notice.

subsection.leadIn: If the Chief Executive is satisfied that the Chairman of the Tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has become bankrupt;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is incapacitated by physical or mental illness; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is otherwise unable or unfit to perform the functions of the Chairman of the Tribunal,

subsection.continued: the Chief Executive may, after consultation with the Chief Justice, declare his office as Chairman of the Tribunal to be vacant, and shall notify the fact in such manner as the Chief Executive thinks fit; and upon such declaration the office becomes vacant.

subsection.content: If a review has been commenced by the Tribunal but not completed before the expiry of the term of office of the Chairman of the Tribunal, the Chief Executive may authorize the Chairman to continue to act as the Chairman for the purpose of completing the review.
A panel member shall be appointed for a term not exceeding 3 years.
On the expiry of his period of appointment or reappointment, a panel member is eligible for reappointment for such further term as the Chief Executive may specify.

A panel member may resign from office by giving notice in writing to the Chief Executive. A notice of resignation takes effect on the date specified in the notice or, if no date is specified, on the date of receipt by the Chief Executive of the notice.

subsection.leadIn: If the Chief Executive is satisfied that a panel member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has become bankrupt;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is incapacitated by physical or mental illness;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is otherwise unable or unfit to perform the functions of a Tribunal member; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: has become a public officer,

subsection.continued: the Chief Executive may declare his office as panel member to be vacant, and shall notify the fact in such manner as the Chief Executive thinks fit; and upon such declaration the office becomes vacant.

subsection.content: A Tribunal member may resign from office by giving notice in writing to the Financial Secretary. A notice of resignation takes effect on the date specified in the notice or, if no date is specified, on the date of receipt by the Financial Secretary of the notice.
If a Tribunal member ceases to be a panel member, he ceases to be such Tribunal member.
The Chairman of the Tribunal shall convene such sittings of the Tribunal as are necessary to determine a review.

subsection.leadIn: Before convening a sitting under subsection (1) in respect of a review, the Chairman of the Tribunal may give directions to the parties to the review concerning—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: procedural matters to be complied with by the parties; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the time within which the parties are required to comply with such matters.

subsection.leadIn: At a sitting of the Tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chairman of the Tribunal shall preside;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not fewer than 2 Tribunal members shall also be present; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: every question before the Tribunal shall be determined by the opinion of the majority of those referred to in paragraphs (a) and (b) except a question of law which shall be determined by the Chairman of the Tribunal alone.

subsection.content: Every sitting of the Tribunal shall be held in public unless the Tribunal, on its own motion or on the application of any of the parties to the review, determines that in the interests of justice a sitting, or any part of a sitting, shall not be held in public in which case it may hold the sitting, or the relevant part of the sitting, as the case may be, in camera.
If an application is made pursuant to subsection (4) for a determination that a sitting, or any part of a sitting, shall not be held in public, a hearing of the application shall be held in camera.

subsection.leadIn: The parties to a review shall, at any sitting of the Tribunal relating to the review, be entitled to be heard—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in person, or—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of the Board or a corporation, through its officer or its employee;

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: through counsel or a solicitor or, with the leave of the Tribunal, through any other person.

subsection.content: The Chairman of the Tribunal shall prepare or cause to be prepared a record of the proceedings at any sitting of the Tribunal, which shall contain such particulars relating to the proceedings as he considers appropriate.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Miscellaneous
section.content: Except as otherwise provided in this Ordinance, the Tribunal, its Chairman and its members, and the parties to, and any witness, counsel, solicitor, or any other person involved in, a review, shall have the same privileges and immunities in respect of the review as they would have if the review were civil proceedings before the Court of First Instance.

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: AmountOfRelevantDeposits
def.leadIn: amount of relevant deposits (有關存款款額), in relation to a Scheme member, means, subject to subsection (2), the aggregate amount held by all depositors of the Scheme member, being the sum arrived at by adding up any of the following amounts held by each of the depositors of the Scheme member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of all relevant deposits held by one person, as a depositor, with the Scheme member in that person’s own right, up to a limit of $800,000;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount of all relevant deposits held by a depositor, as a bare trustee under one bare trust, with the Scheme member, up to a limit of $800,000;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount of all relevant deposits held by a depositor with the Scheme member in one client account, up to a limit of $800,000; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the amount of all relevant deposits held by a depositor, as a trustee under one trust, with the Scheme member, up to a limit of $800,000; (Replaced 11 of 2010 s. 13. Amended 2 of 2016 s. 11; 19 of 2024 s. 11)

subsection.def: build-up levy (建立期徵費) means the build-up levy payable by a Scheme member under section 3(4);
expected loss levy (預期損失徵費) means the expected loss levy payable by a Scheme member under section 4(2);

def.name: SpecifiedDate
def.leadIn: specified date (指明日期), in relation to a year, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 20 October of that year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where 20 October of that year is a public holiday, the day (not being a public holiday) immediately preceding that date; (Added L.N. 107 of 2006. Amended L.N. 175 of 2006)

subsection.def: start-up year (啟動年) means the year in which this Schedule commences*; (Added L.N. 107 of 2006)
target fund size (基金目標金額), in relation to a year, means the size of the Fund that the Board seeks to achieve and maintain for that year.

subsection.leadIn: In the definition of amount of relevant deposits—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to a relevant deposit—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: includes a portion of the deposit; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: does not include any interest accrued on the deposit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of paragraph (a) of that definition, if a relevant deposit is held by a depositor consisting of 2 or more persons—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), each of the 2 or more persons is deemed to have an equal share in the deposit unless the contrary is proved to the satisfaction of the Board; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the 2 or more persons carry on business in partnership, those persons are a single and continuing body of persons as distinct from the persons who may from time to time be the members of the partnership; and (Amended 2 of 2016 s. 11)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for the purposes of paragraphs (b) and (d) of that definition, if a relevant deposit is held by a depositor consisting of 2 or more persons, those persons are a single and continuing body of persons as distinct from the persons who may from time to time be the bare trustees or trustees. (Amended 2 of 2016 s. 11)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule, the target fund size is reached in a particular year if the sum of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the aggregate amount of contributions payable by all Scheme members for that particular year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the balance of the Fund as at the specified date of the immediately preceding year, (Amended L.N. 107 of 2006)

subsection.continued: is equal to or greater than the target fund size for that particular year.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Calculation of target fund size and balance of Fund

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Schedule, the target fund size for any particular year is the specified percentage of the aggregate of the amount of relevant deposits maintained with each of the Scheme members as at the specified date of the immediately preceding year.

For the purposes of this Schedule, the balance of the Fund as at the specified date of any year is the amount by which the total assets of the Fund exceed its total liabilities as shown in a balance sheet of the Fund, as at that date, prepared by the Board.

subsection.def: In this section, specified percentage (指明百分比) means 0.25%. (Amended 11 of 2010 s. 13)

subsection.content: This section applies to any year up to and including the year in which the target fund size has been reached for the first time after the commencement* of this Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: If, after the year in which the target fund size has been reached for the first time after the commencement of this Schedule, the target fund size for a particular year becomes, as a result of a specified amendment, greater than the balance of the Fund as at the specified date of the immediately preceding year, this section also applies to— (Amended L.N. 107 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that particular year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any subsequent year up to and including the year in which the target fund size is reached for the first time after the commencement of that specified amendment.

subsection.leadIn: If, after the year in which the target fund size has been reached for the first time after the commencement of a specified amendment, the target fund size for a particular year becomes, as a result of another specified amendment, greater than the balance of the Fund as at the specified date of the immediately preceding year, this section also applies to— (Amended L.N. 107 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that particular year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any subsequent year up to and including the year in which the target fund size is reached for the first time after the commencement of that other specified amendment.

subsection.content: A build-up levy is payable by a Scheme member for any year to which this section applies.

Subject to subsections (6) and (7) and section 6, the amount of build-up levy payable by a Scheme member for any year (other than the start-up year) is the sum calculated by multiplying the amount of relevant deposits maintained with the Scheme member as at the specified date of the immediately preceding year by the percentage specified in column 2 of the following Table opposite the MA supervisory rating of the Scheme member specified in column 1 of that Table. subsection.name: 5A
subsection.content: Subject to section 6, the amount of build-up levy payable by a Scheme member for the start-up year is such portion of the amount of build-up levy that would have been payable by the Scheme member for the start-up year if that Scheme member had been a member of the Scheme during the whole of the year that the number of days during which this Schedule is in operation in the start-up year bears to 365. (Added L.N. 107 of 2006)

subsection.name: 5B
subsection.leadIn: That amount of build-up levy that would have been payable for the start-up year is the sum calculated by multiplying the amount of relevant deposits maintained with the Scheme member as at—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the Scheme member becomes a member of the Scheme on or before the specified date in the year immediately preceding the start-up year, that specified date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Scheme member becomes a member of the Scheme after that specified date, the date on which it becomes a member of the Scheme,

subsection.continued: by the percentage specified in column 2 of the Table set out in subsection (5) opposite the MA supervisory rating of the Scheme member specified in column 1 of that Table. (Added L.N. 107 of 2006)

subsection.content: If the amount by which the target fund size for a particular year exceeds the balance of the Fund as at the specified date of the immediately preceding year is smaller than the aggregate amount of build-up levies that would, but for this subsection, have been payable by all Scheme members for that particular year in accordance with subsection (5), the amount of build-up levy payable by a Scheme member for that particular year is such portion of the amount of build-up levy that would have been payable by the Scheme member for that year in accordance with subsection (5) that such amount of excess bears to such aggregate amount. (Amended L.N. 107 of 2006)

If the target fund size for a particular year does not exceed the balance of the Fund as at the specified date of the immediately preceding year, no build-up levy is payable for that particular year. (Amended L.N. 107 of 2006)

For the avoidance of doubt, the percentage specified in column 2 of the Table in subsection (5) may be revised by way of an amendment to this section before, during or after the year in which the target fund size is reached for the first time after the commencement of this Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpecifiedAmendment
def.leadIn: specified amendment (指明的修訂) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an amendment to the definition of specified percentage in section 2(3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an amendment to increase the dollar amount specified in section 27(1) or (2) of this Ordinance. (Replaced 19 of 2024 s. 11)

subsection.content: This section applies to any year after the year in which the target fund size has been reached for the first time after the commencement* of this Schedule, except a year to which section 3 applies by virtue of subsection (2) or (3) of that section.
An expected loss levy is payable by a Scheme member for any year to which this section applies.

Subject to section 6, the amount of expected loss levy payable by a Scheme member for any year is the sum calculated by multiplying the amount of relevant deposits maintained with the Scheme member as at the specified date of the immediately preceding year by the percentage specified in column 2 of the following Table opposite the MA supervisory rating of the Scheme member specified in column 1 of that Table.
